text: Frank Bunker Gilbreth (July 7, 1868 â€“ June 14, 1924) was an American engineer, consultant, and author. He was known as an early supporter of scientific management and time and motion study. He is best known as the father and main figure of Cheaper by the Dozen. Both he and his wife Lillian Moller Gilbreth were industrial engineers. They were key figures to the study of industrial engineering. ==References== Category:1868 births Category:1924 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Engineers from Maine Category:American autobiographers Category:Writers from Maine Category:Scientists from Maine Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Scientists from New Jersey Category:American industrial engineers
title: Frank Bunker Gilbreth
